articles.title: A New Species Dubbed the Prehistoric 'Sea Dragon' Discovered in English Channel - IGN - IGN
articles.description: A new, mysterious marine reptile from 150 million years ago called the "sea dragon" has been discovered in Dorset, England.
articles.content: A new, mysterious small marine reptile from 150 million years ago, known as the Thalassodraco etchesi or Etches sea dragon, was recently discovered in a Late Jurassic deep marine deposit along the En… [+2269 chars]

articles.author: Dan Avery
articles.title: ISS astronauts celebrate Christmas with decorating contest, canned mackerel and 'visit' from Santa - Daily Mail
articles.description: The Expedition 64 crew sent season's greetings in videos beamed from the ISS. The team also challenged NASA flight director Zebulon Scoville to a Christmas decorating contest.
articles.content:
Christmas isn't just an earthbound holiday: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station beamed special holiday greetings this week from 254 miles above the planet.

articles.title: Ask Ethan: Is Einstein’s Cosmological Constant The Same As Dark Energy? - Forbes
articles.description: It might have been Einstein's greatest blunder, but it's our leading theory today.
articles.content: The far distant fates of the Universe offer a number of possibilities, but if dark energy is truly a ... [+] constant, as the data indicates, it will continue to follow the red curve, leading to the … [+17201 chars]
